text: hi everyone I'm Robin and in this video
I'm gonna talk about some culture shock
I first had when I came to Korea well I
used to teach at the adult hog wand and
I arrived in Korea in May and at the end
of June we had a lot of university
students coming to the hog one for the
summer vacation and these university
students were very excited to meet me
and they wanted to show me around Korea
well the first place we went one of the
students asked me hey Robin do you want
to go to Seoul and on Saturday I was
like sure let's go to Seoul and I've
never been there yet so there's a group
of 10 of us and he explained that
because there's so many people that
usually one person collects all the
money and then one person just spends
all the money for everyone on that day
and when he explained that I was like
what what's that you know in Canada you
know I I just buy everything for myself
okay but he explained in Korea they're
gonna group all the money together and
one person will pay for everything on
that day and I was like that's so
strange but okay so I asked him how much
he said well you give me thirty thousand
one and that'll pain for you to get into
the park and I'll buy all your food for
that day and I was like okay so I gave
him thirty thousand one and then on the
Saturday we met as a group ten people
and we went into the park and we enjoyed
the rides and everything but all day you
know every time he spent money I was
calculating in my mind how much is he
spending you know how much is he
spending on me
because I gave him thirty thousand long
I want to make sure that he spends
thirty thousand won on me that day so
every time he bought something I was
calculating in my head
anyway at the end of the day when we're
going home I calculated that actually he
only spent about 25,000 won on me or are
the other people too so I thought he
made some profit okay he made some money
from us so I was a little bit angry oh I
didn't like that system because you know
I gave him my money at the end of the
day he had extra money he didn't give it
back okay that's not fair so Sunday I
was thinking about that geez you know
that's not good and then Monday morning
I had to go to the class with the
students and meet him and the other
students so I went to class and inside
the class that student who had collected
the money with all the extra money he
had bought some cakes and drinks and we
had a little party okay so I was very
surprised and happy he didn't just keep
the extra money but he used it to buy
something we could all share alright so
that was my culture shock experience
when I first came to Korea I was a
little confused and angry at first but
in the end I thought it's a good
experience I hope you enjoyed my story
see you next time
